p: Reduced atraumatic mortality due to physical activity and cardiovascular disease mortality due to reduced NO 2 exposure is displayed in relation to 100,000 inhabitants in Figure 5, summarized for all cities. Due to increased physical activity and air quality, decreases in mortality between 27 and 58 per 100,000 inhabitants (GM and GE scenario) can be expected. For the Zero Emission scenario this number is even higher with 76 less cases of death/100,000 inhabitants.
